required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Multicenter Extension Study of Taliglucerase Alfa in Pediatric Subjects With Gaucher Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Extension Study of Taliglucerase Alfa in Pediatric Subjects With Gaucher Disease

brief_summary.textblock: A protocol to extend the assessment of the safety and efficacy of taliglucerase alfa in pediatric subjects (2 to <18 years old) with symptoms and clinical manifestations of Gaucher disease who completed treatment in Protocols PB-06-002 (switchover study from imiglucerase) or PB-06-005 (na√Øve treatment with taliglucerase alfa).

primary_outcome.description: Median and interquartile range. Baseline is the value obtained from the parent study: PB-06-005 for 30 and 60 Units/kg arms and PB-06-002 from Switchover arm.

secondary_outcome.description: Chitotriosidase. Baseline is the value obtained from the parent study: PB-06-005 for 30 and 60 Units/kg arms and PB-06-002 from Switchover arm.
Spleen volume measured by MRI (or ultrasound). Baseline is the value obtained from the parent study: PB-06-005 for 30 and 60 Units/kg arms and PB-06-002 from Switchover arm.
Platelet count. Baseline is the value obtained from the parent study: PB-06-005 for 30 and 60 Units/kg arms and PB-06-002 from Switchover arm.
Liver volume by MRI or Ultrasound. Baseline is the value obtained from the parent study: PB-06-005 for 30 and 60 Units/kg arms and PB-06-002 from Switchover arm.

intervention.description: Taliglucerase alfa for infusion every two weeks for 24 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Successful completion of Protocol PB-06-002 or PB-06-005
- The subject, parent(s) or legal guardian(s) signs an informed consent and/or assent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Currently taking another investigational drug for any condition.
- Presence of neurological signs and symptoms characteristic of Gaucher disease with complex neuronopathic features other than longstanding oculomotor gaze palsy.
- Presence of any medical, emotional, behavioral or psychological condition that in the judgment of the Investigator would interfere with the subject's compliance with the requirements of the study.

outcome.title: Hemoglobin
outcome.description: Median and interquartile range. Baseline is the value obtained from the parent study: PB-06-005 for 30 and 60 Units/kg arms and PB-06-002 from Switchover arm.
outcome.population: Two Switchover Patients completed 18 months treatment due to early closure of the study site and continued in a compassionate use program

event.description: (Grade 2 Dengue Fever), which required hospitalization, resolved in 5 weeks and was assessed as not related to study drug

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
